metrics.name: aerospike_namespace_dead_partitions
metrics.description: example, for a replication factor 2 namespace configured as strong consistent on a 10 node cluster, shutting down one node, waiting for migrations to complete, then shutting down a second node, erasing storage and bringing both nodes back in results in approximately 90 partitions [2x(4096/(10x9))] being marked as dead. Invoking the revive and recluster commands provide 100% availability, and, in this particular case, no data inconsistencies. Dead partitions turn into unavailable_partitions every time the roster is not complete for a namespace. See Configuring strong consistency and Consistency management for further details.

metrics.name: aerospike_namespace_xdr_tombstones
metrics.description: tombstones are deleted after they have been shipped via XDR. The XDR tomb raider runs as specified in xdr-tomb-raider-period and uses xdr-tomb-raider-threads to reduce the index and delete XDR tombstones where the last update time (LUT) is older than the current global last ship time (GLST). The GLST is computed as the lowest value across the last ship time (LST) of all the partitions for the namespace. This is done by having each node send the LST for each partition they own to the principal node which then determines the lowest value and sends it back to all nodes in the cluster via the system metadata (SMD) fabric channel.

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_dc_ship_idle_avg_pct
metrics.description: Representation in percent of total time spent for dc_ship_idle_avg

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_dc_ship_inflight_objects
metrics.description: Number of records that are inflight (which have been shipped but for which a response from the remote DC has not yet been received)

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_dc_ship_latency_avg
metrics.description: Moving average of shipping latency for the specific DC

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_dc_ship_source_error
metrics.description: Number of client layer errors while shipping records for this DC

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_dc_ship_success
metrics.description: Number of records that have been successfully shipped

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_dc_state
metrics.description: are the different statuses: CLUSTER_INACTIVE, CLUSTER_UP, CLUSTER_DOWN, CLUSTER_WINDOW_SHIP

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_dc_timelag
metrics.description: Context xdr Time lag for this specific DC

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_dlog_free_pct
metrics.description: Percentage of the digest log free and available for use

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_dlog_logged
metrics.description: Number of records logged into digest log

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_dlog_overwritten_error
metrics.description: Number of digest log entries that got overwritten

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_dlog_processed_link_down
metrics.description: Number of linkdown that were processed

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_dlog_processed_main
metrics.description: Number of records processed on the local Aerospike server

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_dlog_processed_replica
metrics.description: Number of records processed for a node in the cluster that is not the local node

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_dlog_relogged
metrics.description: Number of records relogged by this node into the digest log due to temporary issues when attempting to ship

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_dlog_used_objects
metrics.description: Total number of records slots used in the digest log

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_filtered_out
metrics.description: watch Context xdr Number of local records that are skipped after having been read but before actual shipment

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_global_lastshiptime
metrics.description: Minimum last ship time in millisecond (epoch) for XDR for across the cluster

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_hot_keys
metrics.description: watch Context xdr Number of times a record write is skipped from processing because that record is already pending processing

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_hotkey_fetch
metrics.description: If there are hot keys in the system (same record updated quite frequently), XDR optimizes by not shipping all the updates

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_hotkey_skip
metrics.description: Replaces noship_recs_dup_intrabatch and noship_recs_genmismatch

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_in_progress
metrics.description: watch Context xdr Number of records that are pending completion

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_in_queue
metrics.description: watch Context xdr Number of records in the in-memory transaction queue still to be processed

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_lag
metrics.description: critical Context xdr Lag in seconds between the destination and the source datacenters

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_lap_us
metrics.description: Context xdr Time in microseconds (μsecs) taken to process records across partitions in one lap (processing cycle)

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_latency_ms
metrics.description: Context xdr Average network latency for the successfully shipped latency

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_local_recs_migration_retry
metrics.description: Number of records missing in a batch call, generally a result of migrations, but can also be caused by expiration and eviction

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_nodes
metrics.description: watch Context xdr Number of nodes in the destination DC as seen by XDR

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_not_found
metrics.description: watch Context xdr Number of local records not found by XDR when attempting to read them

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_queue_overflow_error
metrics.description: Number of XDR queue overflow errors

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_read_active_avg_pct
metrics.description: This statistics reflects how busy the XDR read threads are by calculating, the average time in percent of total time that the XDR read threads spend actually processing something vs

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_read_error
metrics.description: Number of read requests initiated by XDR that failed

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_read_idle_avg_pct
metrics.description: This is a sister statistic to xdr_read_active_avg_pct and represents the average time in percent of total time that the XDR read threads waits for a new digest log entry to arrive on their queues from the dlogreader / failed node shippers / window shippers

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_read_latency_avg
metrics.description: Moving average latency in milliseconds for XDR to read a record

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_read_notfound
metrics.description: Number of read requests initiated by XDR that were not found

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_read_reqq_used
metrics.description: How many digest log entries are currently in the XDR read threads queues

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_read_reqq_used_pct
metrics.description: Sister statistic to xdr_read_reqq_used to represent how full in percent the XDR read request queues are

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_read_respq_used
metrics.description: How many entries are being used in the XDR read response queues

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_read_success
metrics.description: Number of read requests initiated by XDR that succeeded

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_read_txnq_used
metrics.description: Number of XDR read commands that are in flight in the local transaction queue

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_read_txnq_used_pct
metrics.description: Percent used of the XDR read commands that are in flight (out of a maximum allowed of 10,000) in the transaction queue

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_recoveries
metrics.description: Context xdr Number of partitions that are recovered by reducing the primary index of that partition

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_recoveries_pending
metrics.description: Context xdr Number of recoveries currently pending

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_relogged_incoming
metrics.description: at the source cluster, when there are outstanding digest log entries and the partition ownership changes by the time they are processed, if the local node does not own master or prole copy of the partition such record belongs to, the node now owning the master copy of the partition would get an incoming digest log entry relogged to it.

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_relogged_outgoing
metrics.description: Number of records relogged to another node's digest log

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_retry_conn_reset
metrics.description: Context xdr Number of records whose shipment is retried due to a reset of the connection to the remote datacenter

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_retry_dest
metrics.description: Context xdr Number of records retried due to a temporary error returned by destination node

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_retry_no_node
metrics.description: Context xdr Number of records retried because XDR cannot determine which destination node is the master

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_ship_bytes
metrics.description: watch Context xdr Estimated number of bytes XDR has shipped to remote clusters

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_ship_compression_avg_pct
metrics.description: Used to determine how beneficial compression is (higher is better)

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_ship_delete_success
metrics.description: Context xdr Number of delete operations that were successfully shipped

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_ship_destination_error
metrics.description: Number of errors from the remote cluster(s) while shipping records

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_ship_destination_permanent_error
metrics.description: Number of permanent errors from the remote cluster(s) while shipping records

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_ship_fullrecord
metrics.description: Number of records that did not take advantage of bin level shipping (see xdr-ship-bins)

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_ship_inflight_objects
metrics.description: Number of objects that are inflight (which have been shipped but for which a response from the remote DC has not yet been received)

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_ship_latency_avg
metrics.description: Context xdr Moving average latency in milliseconds to ship a record to remote Aerospike clusters

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_ship_outstanding_objects
metrics.description: Context xdr Number of outstanding records not yet processed

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_ship_source_error
metrics.description: Number of client layer errors while shipping records

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_ship_success
metrics.description: Number of records successfully shipped to remote Aerospike clusters (across all datacenters configured, meaning one record successfully shipped to 3 different datacenters will increment this counter by 3)

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_stat_pipe_reads_diginfo
metrics.description: Number of digest information read from the named pipe

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_success
metrics.description: Context xdr Number of records successfully shipped to remote datacenters

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_throughput
metrics.description: watch Context xdr Number of records successfully shipped per second

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_timelag
metrics.description: Time in seconds it took the latest shipped record from the moment it was first written at the source until it was attempted to be shipped to the destination cluster

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_uncompressed_pct
metrics.description: Running average percentage of records not compressed because they are below the compression threshold (100) or failed to be compressed at all

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_uninitialized_destination_error
metrics.description: Number of records in the digest log not shipped because the destination cluster has not been initialized for a DC that is configured for a namespace

metrics.name: aerospike_xdr_unknown_namespace_error
metrics.description: Number of records in the digest log not shipped because they belong to an unknown namespace, on the source cluster
